evidence.text: Person B: Bed rest is great. I can't go anywhere. Or do anything. But really, I'm fine. I can't wait to be a Mom, but I miss my kids. If all goes well, I'll be back at school full-time next fall.

Person A: Hey, Mikey. You almost have it. Remember. Point, Push and Pull. You got this kid.
Person A: I see a lacrosse title in our future, boys. Whatever you're feeding those sons of yours, it's working.

Person A: I'll be honest, Allison and I weren't sure about whether to have this party. But together there's nothing we can't overcome. You're the strongest woman I know and I love you more than anything. And I am so damn excited to keep building our life together.

Person A: "So...?" I asked. "What's the verdict?" Do you remember what you said?
Person B: "You're the kind of guy who forgets his wallet on a first date and is too scared to tell me."
Person B: What happened to wildly inappropriate?
Person A: I'm saving that for you. They said it'll be a short trial.
Person B: It's all gonna be fine, babe.
Person B: We're gonna have a family.

Person B: Everyone deserves a chance, right? I keep thinking about where I'd be if you hadn't given me one...
Person B: Can I ask you something?
Person B: Just go with me. If they’re never the wiser and nobody gets hurt, did I do anything wrong?
Person A: If no one gets hurt, then no. I suppose not. Does that... help?

Person B: My pitchfork.
Person B: This case is really wearing on me.

Person B: About last night...
Person A: I know. Just trust your gut. You'll do the right thing.
Person B: It's been a couple years.

Person A: He's a giant.
Person A: Crazy.

Person B: Ally...
Person A: You took the shortcut home through Old Quarry that night, didn't you?
Person B: Yeah.
Person B: Because it's the truth. It was their due date. And I couldn't deal with it. The feelings I was having... I couldn't bring that into our home, to put that on you. So, I went somewhere else.
Person A: You could've talked to me.
Person B: No. You were in too much pain already. It crushes her to hear that. Tears welling now.
Person B: No...
Person A: They were my babies. And there it is. It was twins that they lost.
Person B: Ally...
Person B: We were both hurting. I'm still hurting.
Person A: Me, too.
Person A: But now we're about to have our family.
Person B: Yeah.
Person A: I can't lose you. I can't do this alone.
Person B: I'll protect our family. I promise.

Person A: He wasn't a good guy. It's not your fault.
Person B: I didn't stand up for him. I told them what they needed to hear and said he couldn't change.
Person A: My girls. It's perfect.

Person A: Yes, Ma'am. I love me some "tummy￾time."
Person A: Really? I think she has mine.
Person A: My mouth! She has my mouth.
